references.paper_title: Nerf: Representing scenes as neural radiance fields for view synthesis
references.reason: This paper introduced Neural Radiance Fields (NeRF), a foundational work in novel view synthesis that significantly advanced the field.  It demonstrated the power of representing scenes as continuous volumetric functions and rendering novel views by querying these functions.  Many subsequent methods build upon NeRF's core concepts, and this paper is therefore highly influential in the field of novel view synthesis.

references.paper_title: Mip-nerf: A multiscale representation for anti-aliasing neural radiance fields
references.reason: This paper addressed the aliasing artifacts present in NeRF renderings by introducing a multiscale representation. It significantly improved the visual quality of NeRF-rendered images and is a significant improvement over the original NeRF paper.  The multiscale approach is a common technique used in many subsequent NeRF-based methods.

references.paper_title: PixelNeRF: Neural radiance fields from one or few images
references.reason: This paper extends NeRF to handle scenarios with limited input views, making it more practical for real-world applications where dense view data might not be available. It is a significant advancement that makes NeRF more applicable to real-world situations.

references.paper_title: Instant neural graphics primitives with a multiresolution hash encoding
references.reason: This paper introduced Instant Neural Graphics Primitives (INGP), a significant advancement that improved both the efficiency and scalability of NeRF rendering.  It provides a faster and more memory-efficient approach compared to the original NeRF implementation.

references.paper_title: 3D Gaussian splatting for real-time radiance field rendering
references.reason: This paper presented 3D Gaussian Splatting, another important advancement that boosted both the rendering speed and quality of NeRF.  Its efficiency makes it suitable for real-time applications and it influenced many subsequent efficient NeRF-related methods.

references.paper_title: Lrm: Large reconstruction model for single image to 3d
references.reason: This paper showcases the potential of large reconstruction models (LRMs) in achieving state-of-the-art results in novel view synthesis.  Its use of large transformers without explicit 3D inductive biases demonstrates a step toward more generalizable and scalable methods.

references.paper_title: Modeling and rendering architecture from photographs: A hybrid geometry- and image-based approach
references.reason: This is a highly influential paper in the field of image-based rendering (IBR). The introduction of hybrid geometry- and image-based methods significantly impacted the field's early development, paving the way for future learning-based methods.

references.paper_title: Nerf: Representing scenes as neural radiance fields for view synthesis
references.reason: This paper, as mentioned before, is the foundational work for many current novel view synthesis methods.  Its impact extends to the following works in this paper as many subsequent methods are either direct extensions or address limitations of this core work.

references.paper_title: Mip-nerf: A multiscale representation for anti-aliasing neural radiance fields
references.reason: This paper addresses the key limitation of the original NeRF work by introducing a multiscale representation to resolve aliasing artifacts that commonly appear in early NeRF approaches.  It was foundational in improving the rendering quality of subsequent works.

references.paper_title: PixelNeRF: Neural radiance fields from one or few images
references.reason: This paper is important due to its ability to handle sparse views, a significant limitation of early NeRF implementations. This makes the approach more practical for real-world applications.

references.paper_title: Instant neural graphics primitives with a multiresolution hash encoding
references.reason: This paper presented a more memory-efficient and faster rendering approach, addressing another limitation of NeRF. Its efficiency influenced many subsequent methods in the field.

references.paper_title: 3D Gaussian splatting for real-time radiance field rendering
references.reason: This paper improved the rendering speed and quality of NeRF using an alternative rendering technique based on Gaussian splatting.  This method has been highly influential in the development of efficient novel view synthesis methods.

references.paper_title: IBRNet: Learning multi-view image-based rendering
references.reason: This paper introduced a learning-based approach to image-based rendering, which is one of the key approaches to NVS.  Its contribution is highly relevant to the research topic and it contributed to the development of other approaches mentioned in this paper.

references.paper_title: Mvsnerf: Fast generalizable radiance field reconstruction from multi-view stereo
references.reason: This paper provided a method to use multi-view stereo data to reconstruct NeRFs efficiently.  This work is important because it showed a path to handle different view configurations in a robust and efficient manner.

references.paper_title: pixelSplat: 3d gaussian splats from image pairs for scalable generalizable 3d reconstruction
references.reason: This work introduced pixelSplat, which improved upon the scalability and generalization of NeRF-based methods.  This paper also addressed the shortcomings of the earlier approaches using more efficient representations.

references.paper_title: Mvsplat: Efficient 3d gaussian splatting from sparse multi-view images
references.reason: This paper improved the efficiency of Gaussian splatting further, making it more applicable to scenarios with sparse views. This is crucial for efficient 3D reconstruction and it is an important improvement upon prior splatting-based approaches.

references.paper_title: Lrm: Large reconstruction model for single image to 3d
references.reason: This paper is important for its focus on large reconstruction models (LRMs) for 3D scene representation.  LRMs provide an important counterpoint to NeRF-based approaches, offering alternative advantages.

references.paper_title: Instant3D: Fast text-to-3d with sparse-view generation and large reconstruction model
references.reason: This paper combined text-to-3D capabilities with efficient 3D reconstruction, showing how LRMs can be used for advanced NVS. This method improves upon the efficiency of the other large reconstruction models.

references.paper_title: Gs-lrm: Large reconstruction model for 3d gaussian splatting
references.reason: This paper combines Gaussian splatting and large reconstruction models, producing a state-of-the-art model for novel view synthesis. This work is very significant as it shows the combined potential of different approaches.

references.paper_title: Perceiver IO: A general architecture for structured inputs & outputs
references.reason: This paper introduced a general architecture called Perceiver IO, which is relevant to the novel approach used in the target paper. This architecture is powerful and versatile and can be used for a wider range of problems, including NVS.
